bitfield.description: Color Space Conversion full range setting. 0h (R/W) = Limited range selected. 1h (R/W) = Full range selected.
Enable the color space conversion. It shall be reset when CPR bit-field is set to 0x1. 0h (R/W) = Disable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV 1h (R/W) = Enable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV
Selects the first field to output in case of interlace mode. In case of progressive mode, the value is not used. 0h (R/W) = First field is even. 1h (R/W) = Odd field is first.
Selects between progressive and interlace mode for the VP output. 0h (R/W) = Progressive mode selected. 1h (R/W) = Interlace mode selected.
Selects BT-1120 format on the VP output. It is not posssible to enable BT656 and BT1120 at the same time on the same VP output. 0h (R/W) = BT-1120 is disabled. 1h (R/W) = BT-1120 is enabled.
Selects BT-656 format on the VP output. It is not posssible to enable BT656 and BT1120 at the same time on the same VP output. 0h (R/W) = BT-656 is disabled. 1h (R/W) = BT-656 is enabled.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0

Controls the handshake between DMA buffer and STALL signal in order to prevent from underflow. The bit shall be set to 0 when the module is not in STALL mode. 0h (R/W) = Only the STALL signal (generated by RFBI) is used regardless of the DMA buffer fullness information in order to provide data to the RFBI module. 1h (R/W) = The STALL signal (generated by RFBI) is used in combination with the DMA buffer fullness information in order to provide data to the RFBI module only when it does not generated buffer underflow.

Color Phase Rotation Control VP output). It shall be reset when ColorConvEnable bit-field is set to 1. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Color Phase Rotation Disabled 1h (R/W) = Color Phase Rotation Enabled
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Selects between external sync and internal sync mode for the VP output. 0h (R/W) = Internal sync mode selected 1h (R/W) = External sync mode selected.
VSYNC Gated Enabled (VP output) Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = VSYNC Gated Disabled 1h (R/W) = VSYNC Gated Enabled
HSYNC Gated Enabled (VP output) Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = HSYNC Gated Disabled 1h (R/W) = HSYNC Gated Enabled
Pixel Clock Gated Enabled (VP output) Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Pixel Clock Gated Disabled 1h (R/W) = Pixel Clock Gated Enabled
Pixel Data Gated Enabled (VP output) Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Pixel Data Gated Disabled 1h (R/W) = Pixel Data Gated Enabled

Configures the timing generator in HDMI compatible mode to generate same timings as HDMI wrapper timings. 0h (R/W) = Disable HDMI mode. 1h (R/W) = Enable HDMI mode timings: - vertical FSM starts with the VFP period (instead of VSYNC) - last frame ends with the last pixel of data state.
Enable the gamma Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Gamma disabled 1h (R/W) = Gamma enabled
DE Gated Enable Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = DE signal is not gated 1h (R/W) = DE signal is gated.
Pixel Gated Enable Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Pixel clock always toggles (only in TFT mode) 1h (R/W) = Pixel clock only toggles when there is valid data to display. (only in TFT mode)

Spatial/Temporal dithering number of frames for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Spatial only 1h (R/W) = Spatial and temporal over 2 frames 2h (R/W) = Spatial and temporal over 4 frames 3h (R/W) = Reserved
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
State of unused bits (TDM mode only) for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = low level (0) 1h (R/W) = high level (1) 2h (R/W) = unchanged from previous state 3h (R/W) = reserved
Cycle format (TDM mode only) for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = 1 cycle for 1 pixel 1h (R/W) = 2 cycles for 1 pixel 2h (R/W) = 3 cycles for 1 pixel 3h (R/W) = 3 cycles for 2 pixels

Output Interface width (TDM mode only) for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = 8-bit parallel output interface selected 1h (R/W) = 9-bit parallel output interface selected 2h (R/W) = 12-bit parallel output interface selected 3h (R/W) = 16-bit parallel output interface selected
Enable the multiple cycle format for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = TDM disabled 1h (R/W) = TDM enabled
Hold Time for VP output. Shadow bit-field. Encoded value (from 1 to 8) to specify the number of external digital clock periods to hold the data (programmed value = value minus one)

STALL Mode for the VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Normal mode selected 1h (R/W) = STALL mode selected. The Display Controller sends the data without considering the VSYNC/HSYNC. The VP output is disabled at the end of the transfer of the frame. The S/W has to re-enable the VP output in order to generate a new frame.

Width of the data bus on VP output. Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = 12-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface 1h (R/W) = 16-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface 2h (R/W) = 18-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface 3h (R/W) = 24-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface 4h (R/W) = 30-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface 5h (R/W) = 36-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
Spatial Temporal dithering enable for the VP output Shadow bit-field. 0h (R/W) = Spatial/Temporal dithering logic disabled 1h (R/W) = Spatial/Temporal dithering logic enabled

GO Command for the VP output. It is used to synchronized the pipelines associated with the VP output. wr:immediate 0h (R/W) = The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the VP output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed. 1h (R/W) = The user has finished to program the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the VP output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the VFP start period

Mono 8-bit mode of the primary LCD 0h (R/W) = Pixel data [3:0] is used to output four pixel values to the panel at each pixel clock transition. (only in Passive Mono 1h (R/W) = Pixel data [7:0] is used to output eight pixel values to the panel each pixel clock transition. (only in Passive Mono
LCD Display type of the primary LCD 0h (R/W) = Passive or STN display operation disabled. 1h (R/W) = Passive or STN display operation enabled. STN dither logic is enabled.
Monochrome/Color selection for the primary LCD 0h (R/W) = Color operation enabled (STN mode only) 1h (R/W) = Monochrome operation enabled (STN mode only)
Enable the modulo of the line number interrupt generation 0h (R/W) = Disable modulo 1h (R/W) = Enable Modulo
Enable the video port output wr:immediate 0h (R/W) = VP output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset) 1h (R/W) = VP output enabled
BR Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
BG Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
BB Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
GR Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
GG Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
GB Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
RR Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
RG Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
RB Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511).
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel#2 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel #2 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel#1 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel #1 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel#2 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel #2 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Bit alignment Alignment of the bits from pixel#1 on the output interface
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Number of bits Number of bits from the pixel #1 (value from 0 to 16 bits). The values from 17 to 31 are invalid.
Defines the location in the table where the bit-field VALUE is stored
8-bit value used to defined the value to be stored in the gamma table
8-bit value used to defined the value to be stored in the gamma table
8-bit value used to defined the value to be stored in the gamma table

AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero 0h (R/W) = ACBIASCOUNTSTATUS for the primary LCD output is masked 1h (R/W) = ACBIASCOUNTSTATUS for the primary LCD output generates an interrupt when it occurs
Synchronization Lost for Video Port. 0h (R/W) = SyncLost for the primary VP output is masked 1h (R/W) = SyncLost for the primary VP output generates an interrupt when it occurs

Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number. 0h (R/W) = ProgrammedLineNumber is masked 1h (R/W) = ProgrammedLineNumber generates an interrupt when it occurs
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only. 0h (R/W) = EVSYNC_ODD for the VP output is masked 1h (R/W) = EVSYNC_ODD for the VP output generates an interrupt when it occurs
Vertical Synchronization for VP. 0h (R/W) = VSYNC for the primary VP output is masked 1h (R/W) = VSYNC for the primary VP output generates an interrupt when it occurs

Frame Done for Video Port. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent. 0h (R/W) = FrameDone for the primary VP output is masked 1h (R/W) = FrameDone for the primary VP output generates an interrupt when it occurs
AC BIAS transition counter has decremented to zero 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

Synchronization Lost on VP output. The required data are not output at the correct time due to too short blanking periods or stall of at least one pipelines associated with VP output. 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

Programmed Line Number. It indicates that the scan of the display has reached the programmed user line number. 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.
VSYNC for odd field from interlace mode only. 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

Vertical Synchronization for VP output. It is used as VSYNC_EVEN in case of interlace mode. 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

Frame Done for VP. VP output has been disabled by user. All the data have been sent. 0h (R/W) = READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged. 1h (R/W) = READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.
Display panel line number programming. Line number defines the line on which the programmable interrupt is generated and the DMA request occurs.
Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
Defines the alignment betwwen HSYNC and VSYNC assertion. 0h (R/W) = VSYNC and HSYNC are not aligned 1h (R/W) = VSYNC and HSYNC assertions are aligned.
HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/Off 0h (R/W) = HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of pixel clock than pixel data 1h (R/W) = HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16

Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or Fall 0h (R/W) = HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on falling edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1) 1h (R/W) = HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on rising edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)
Invert output enable 0h (R/W) = Ac-bias is active high (active display mode) 1h (R/W) = Ac-bias is active low (active display mode)
Invert pixel clock 0h (R/W) = Data is driven on the VP data lines on the rising-edge of the pixel clock 1h (R/W) = Data is driven on the VP data lines on the falling-edge of the pixel clock
Invert HSYNC 0h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active high and inactive low 1h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active low and inactive high
Invert VSYNC 0h (R/W) = Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low 1h (R/W) = Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high
AC Bias Pin transitions per interrupt 0h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active high and inactive low 1h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active low and inactive high
AC Bias Pin Frequency 0h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active high and inactive low 1h (R/W) = Line clock pin is active low and inactive high
Lines per panel Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus one).
Indicates the delta size value of the odd field compared to the even field 0h (R/W) = same size 1h (R/W) = odd size = even size +1 2h (R/W) = Odd size = even size -1

Pixels per line Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display (program to value minus one). In STALL mode, any value is valid. In non STALL mode, only values multiple of 8 pixels are valiid.

Horizontal Back Porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the displaydisplay (program to value minus one). When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 2 for Even Field.

Horizontal front porch. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted display (program to value minus one). When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 1 for Even Field.

Horizontal synchronization pulse width Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line display (program to value minus one). When in BT mode, this field corresponds to the LSB 8-bits of the 12-bit horizontal blanking(BT_HBLANK[11:0]= {VSW[3:0],HSW[7:0]}).

Vertical back porch Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame. When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 2 for Odd Field. When in BT and in progressive mode, this field corresponds to the Vertical frame blanking No 2 . before the first set of pixels is output to the display.

Vertical front porch Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame. When in BT mode and interlaced, this field corresponds to the vertical field blanking No 1 for Odd Field. When in BT and in progressive mode, this field corresponds to the Vertical frame blanking No 2 .

Vertical synchronization pulse width Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode. When in BT mode, the lsb 4-bits of this field (VSW[3:0]) corresponds to the MSB 4-bits of the 12-bit horizontal blanking(BT_HBLANK= {VSW[3:0],HSW[7:0]}).
